de.mdelab.simulator

Interface Simulator

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    SimulatorImpl

    public interface Simulator
    Interface to use the simulator. If the simulator has been obtained from the SimulatorFactory, it must be configured by adding Validators (see addValidator(Validator)) that validate the model in each simulation round after the feedback loop has been executed. After adding validators, the simulator can be used by alternately invoking injectIssues() to inject issues into the model according to the provided Scenario and validateModel() to validate the adaptation and the model using the added Validators. The validators are executed in the same order as they are added to the simulator. The method isSimulationCompleted() is used to check whether the simulation has been completed or not, that is, the specified number of simulation rounds has been achieved. One round consists of invoking once injectIssues(), one run of the feedback loop, and finally invoking once the validateModel(). Inbetween snapshots of the model can be obtained by invoking snapshotModel(). After the simulation has completed, showResults() can be used to produce CSV files and charts of the utility of the managed system and of the performance of the feedback loop. If a feedback loop uses events notifying about changes of the model to drive the self-adaptation process, access to the various event queues can be obtained through getChangeEventsQueues().
    Version:
    0.41
    Author:
    thomas vogel

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static SimulatorFactory FACTORY
      The singleton factory instance to obtain an instance of the Simulator.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addValidator(Validator validator)
      Adds the given validator to the simulator.
      ChangeEventQueues getChangeEventsQueues()
      Returns the queues for events notifying about changes of the model if tracking of change events is enabled, otherwise null.
      void injectIssues()
      Injects issues into the model using the injectors according to the Scenario.
      boolean isSimulationCompleted()
      Returns true if the simulation has been completed, else false.
      void showResults()
      Produces the simulation results in the folder ./results/ of the project.
      void snapshotModel()
      Creates a snapshot of the model and stores the snapshot in the folder ./results/.
      int validateModel()
      Validates the model using the analyzers.

    • Field Detail

      • FACTORY

        static final SimulatorFactory FACTORY
        The singleton factory instance to obtain an instance of the Simulator.

    • Method Detail

      • addValidator

        void addValidator(Validator validator)
        Adds the given validator to the simulator.
        Parameters:
        validator - the validator to be added.

      • validateModel

        int validateModel()
        Validates the model using the analyzers.
        Returns:
        the number of issues identified by the validation.

      • injectIssues

        void injectIssues()
        Injects issues into the model using the injectors according to the Scenario. The issues injected by one invocation of this method should be handled by one run of the feedback loop. Hence, one invocation of this method corresponds to one run of the simulator.

      • isSimulationCompleted

        boolean isSimulationCompleted()
        Returns true if the simulation has been completed, else false.
        Returns:
        true if the simulation has been completed, else false.

      • snapshotModel

        void snapshotModel()
        Creates a snapshot of the model and stores the snapshot in the folder ./results/.

      • showResults

        void showResults()
        Produces the simulation results in the folder ./results/ of the project. These results comprise the utility of the managed system and the execution time of the feedback loop.

      • getChangeEventsQueues

        ChangeEventQueues getChangeEventsQueues()
        Returns the queues for events notifying about changes of the model if tracking of change events is enabled, otherwise null.
        Returns:
        the queues for events notifying about changes of the model if tracking of change events is enabled, otherwise null.
